name: peanut
description: PeaNUT is a self-hosted network visualization tool that provides insights into connected devices and services within homelab environments. It offers graph views for network topology and metadata.
features: Network visualization: Interactive graph displays network topology showing connections between devices and services
Device discovery: Automatically detect and map connected devices, servers, and services across your network
Service monitoring: Track running services and their relationships to understand dependencies and system architecture
Metadata display: View detailed information about each device including IP addresses, hostnames, and service details
Topology mapping: Visual representation of network structure helps identify bottlenecks and plan infrastructure changes
Homelab focused: Designed specifically for home server environments with features tailored to self-hosted setups
Real-time updates: Network graph updates automatically as devices come online or offline for current visibility
Custom grouping: Organize devices into logical groups or categories for better organization of complex networks
